raw_text:
Mourinho takes swipe at Arsenal
 
 Chelsea boss Jose Mourinho has attempted to pile the pressure on title rivals Arsenal ahead of the Gunners facing Newcastle on Wednesday.
 
 Arsenal will play the Magpies a day after Chelsea beat Portsmouth during a busy festive programme. And Mourinho said: "They always seem to have two or three days' rest in which to recover. Perhaps it's something to do with the television schedule. "All my players are tired, especially John Terry."
 
 Chelsea boss Jose Mourinho admitted his side were "lucky" to win at Fratton Park but is still unhappy with the amount of games in such a short space of time during this time of year. He added: "We have had to play two matches in three days which is foreign to many of my players and, although I understand the traditions of football here at this time of year, it is not good for your health to do it.
 
 "You can sit back and smoke cigars, one after another, and it is a good life, but it is not actually good for you. "Playing so many games is certainly not healthy, especially for teams who still have European commitment."
llama3.2:1b: Jose Mourinho has criticized Arsenal for their slow recovery from the Portsmouth match, saying they seem to be getting more rest during this busy festive period.
He also expressed concerns about playing too many games in a short amount of time, citing his own team's struggles with fatigue.
llama3.2:3b: Jose Mourinho criticized Arsenal ahead of their match against Newcastle, saying they seem to get extra rest before playing.
He also mentioned that Chelsea had to play two matches in three days and felt it was unhealthy for players' health, particularly those with European commitments.
gemma2:2b: Jose Mourinho criticizes Arsenal's schedule, claiming they have more rest than Chelsea during the busy festive period.
He expresses concern about players being fatigued and calls playing multiple games in a short span detrimental to their health, particularly those involved in European competition.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Chelsea manager Jose Mourinho suggests Arsenal will face Newcastle on Wednesday while also trying to pressure them ahead of the Gunners' match against Newcastle United at home on Thursday.

Mourinho acknowledges that they have rested their players with two or three days off between matches, but stresses that this is not healthy for him and his team as it does not allow them adequate rest after long fits of play.
Chelsea manager Jose Mourinho admitted to having "lucky" victory over Fratton Park but was still unhappy with the amount of games during such a short time of year.
He also expressed worry about smoke breaks, stating that playing so many matches in one day is certainly not good for team members and health.
In summary, Mourinho's side will face Newcastle United on Wednesday while he continues to try to pressure Arsenal ahead of their match against Newcastle United at home on Thursday.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Chelsea manager Jose Mourinho criticizes Arsenal's frequent rest days ahead of their match against Newcastle on Wednesday due to concerns about player health and the high number of late-season fixtures.
qwen2.5:3b: Jose Mourinho criticizes Arsenal's rest periods ahead of their match against Newcastle, suggesting the Gunners benefit from shorter recovery times due to TV schedules.

He claims Chelsea are "lucky" to have won at Portsmouth but remains concerned about the intense fixture schedule, which he says is detrimental to his players' health, particularly those with ongoing European commitments.

Overall, Mourinho expresses frustration with the lengthy schedule but remains optimistic about his team's ability to achieve results despite their short-term challenges.
